enum.name: MAV_TYPE
enum.description: MAVLINK component type reported in HEARTBEAT message. Flight controllers must report the type of the vehicle on which they are mounted (e.g. MAV_TYPE_OCTOROTOR). All other components must report a value appropriate for their type (e.g. a camera must use MAV_TYPE_CAMERA).

entry.description: Generic micro air vehicle

enum.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE
enum.description: These values define the type of firmware release. These values indicate the first version or release of this type. For example the first alpha release would be 64, the second would be 65.

entry.description: development release

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_ALPHA
entry.description: alpha release

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_BETA
entry.description: beta release

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_RC
entry.description: release candidate

entry.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_OFFICIAL
entry.description: official stable release

entry.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_RC_RECEIVER

entry.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_OFFBOARD_LINK
entry.description: Offboard link failure.

entry.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_ENGINE
entry.description: Engine failure.

entry.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_GEOFENCE

entry.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_MISSION
entry.description: Mission failure.

enum.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode the MAV mode.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED
entry.description: 0b10000000 MAV safety set to armed. Motors are enabled / running / can start. Ready to fly. Additional note: this flag is to be ignore when sent in the command MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE and MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM shall be used instead. The flag can still be used to report the armed state.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_INPUT_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b01000000 remote control input is enabled.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_HIL_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00100000 hardware in the loop simulation. All motors / actuators are blocked, but internal software is full operational.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00010000 system stabilizes electronically its attitude (and optionally position). It needs however further control inputs to move around.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_GUIDED_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00001000 guided mode enabled, system flies waypoints / mission items.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_AUTO_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000100 autonomous mode enabled, system finds its own goal positions. Guided flag can be set or not, depends on the actual implementation.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_TEST_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000010 system has a test mode enabled. This flag is intended for temporary system tests and should not be used for stable implementations.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_CUSTOM_MODE_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000001 Reserved for future use.

enum.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION
enum.description: These values encode the bit positions of the decode position. These values can be used to read the value of a flag bit by combining the base_mode variable with AND with the flag position value. The result will be either 0 or 1, depending on if the flag is set or not.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_SAFETY
entry.description: First bit: 10000000

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_MANUAL
entry.description: Second bit: 01000000

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_HIL
entry.description: Third bit: 00100000

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_STABILIZE
entry.description: Fourth bit: 00010000

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_GUIDED
entry.description: Fifth bit: 00001000

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_AUTO
entry.description: Sixth bit: 00000100

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_TEST
entry.description: Seventh bit: 00000010

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_CUSTOM_MODE
entry.description: Eighth bit: 00000001

enum.name: MAV_GOTO
enum.description: Actions that may be specified in MAV_CMD_OVERRIDE_GOTO to override mission execution.

entry.name: MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD
entry.description: Hold at the current position.

entry.name: MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE
entry.description: Continue with the next item in mission execution.

entry.name: MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION
entry.description: Hold at the current position of the system

entry.name: MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION
entry.description: Hold at the position specified in the parameters of the DO_HOLD action

enum.name: MAV_MODE
enum.description: These defines are predefined OR-combined mode flags. There is no need to use values from this enum, but it simplifies the use of the mode flags. Note that manual input is enabled in all modes as a safety override.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_PREFLIGHT
entry.description: System is not ready to fly, booting, calibrating, etc. No flag is set.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_STABILIZE_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under assisted RC control.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_STABILIZE_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under assisted RC control.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_MANUAL_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under manual (RC) control, no stabilization

entry.name: MAV_MODE_MANUAL_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under manual (RC) control, no stabilization

entry.name: MAV_MODE_GUIDED_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control, manual setpoint

entry.name: MAV_MODE_GUIDED_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control, manual setpoint

entry.name: MAV_MODE_AUTO_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control and navigation (the trajectory is decided onboard and not pre-programmed by waypoints)

entry.name: MAV_MODE_AUTO_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control and navigation (the trajectory is decided onboard and not pre-programmed by waypoints)

entry.name: MAV_MODE_TEST_DISARMED
entry.description: UNDEFINED mode. This solely depends on the autopilot - use with caution, intended for developers only.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_TEST_ARMED
entry.description: UNDEFINED mode. This solely depends on the autopilot - use with caution, intended for developers only.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_UNINIT
entry.description: Uninitialized system, state is unknown.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_BOOT
entry.description: System is booting up.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_CALIBRATING
entry.description: System is calibrating and not flight-ready.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_STANDBY
entry.description: System is grounded and on standby. It can be launched any time.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_ACTIVE
entry.description: System is active and might be already airborne. Motors are engaged.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_CRITICAL
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It can however still navigate.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_EMERGENCY
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It lost control over parts or over the whole airframe. It is in mayday and going down.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_POWEROFF
entry.description: System just initialized its power-down sequence, will shut down now.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_FLIGHT_TERMINATION
entry.description: System is terminating itself.

enum.name: MAV_COMPONENT
enum.description: Component ids (values) for the different types and instances of onboard hardware/software that might make up a MAVLink system (autopilot, cameras, servos, GPS systems, avoidance systems etc.). Components must use the appropriate ID in their source address when sending messages. Components can also use IDs to determine if they are the intended recipient of an incoming message. The MAV_COMP_ID_ALL value is used to indicate messages that must be processed by all components. When creating new entries, components that can have multiple instances (e.g. cameras, servos etc.) should be allocated sequential values. An appropriate number of values should be left free after these components to allow the number of instances to be expanded.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_ALL
entry.description: Target id (target_component) used to broadcast messages to all components of the receiving system. Components should attempt to process messages with this component ID and forward to components on any other interfaces. Note: This is not a valid *source* component id for a message.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_AUTOPILOT1
entry.description: System flight controller component ("autopilot"). Only one autopilot is expected in a particular system.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_USER1
entry.description: Id for a component on privately managed MAVLink network. Can be used for any purpose but may not be published by components outside of the private network.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL
entry.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame + MSL altitude. First value / x: latitude, second value / y: longitude, third value / z: positive altitude over mean sea level (MSL).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED
entry.description: Local coordinate frame, Z-down (x: north, y: east, z: down).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_MISSION
entry.description: NOT a coordinate frame, indicates a mission command.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_RELATIVE_ALT
entry.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame + altitude relative to the home position. First value / x: latitude, second value / y: longitude, third value / z: positive altitude with 0 being at the altitude of the home location.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_ENU
entry.description: Local coordinate frame, Z-up (x: east, y: north, z: up).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_INT
entry.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame (scaled) + MSL altitude. First value / x: latitude in degrees*1.0e-7, second value / y: longitude in degrees*1.0e-7, third value / z: positive altitude over mean sea level (MSL).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_RELATIVE_ALT_INT
entry.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame (scaled) + altitude relative to the home position. First value / x: latitude in degrees*10e-7, second value / y: longitude in degrees*10e-7, third value / z: positive altitude with 0 being at the altitude of the home location.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_OFFSET_NED
entry.description: Offset to the current local frame. Anything expressed in this frame should be added to the current local frame position.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_BODY_NED
entry.description: Setpoint in body NED frame. This makes sense if all position control is externalized - e.g. useful to command 2 m/s^2 acceleration to the right.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_BODY_OFFSET_NED
entry.description: Offset in body NED frame. This makes sense if adding setpoints to the current flight path, to avoid an obstacle - e.g. useful to command 2 m/s^2 acceleration to the east.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_TERRAIN_ALT
entry.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame with AGL altitude (at the waypoint coordinate). First value / x: latitude in degrees, second value / y: longitude in degrees, third value / z: positive altitude in meters with 0 being at ground level in terrain model.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_TERRAIN_ALT_INT
entry.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame (scaled) with AGL altitude (at the waypoint coordinate). First value / x: latitude in degrees*10e-7, second value / y: longitude in degrees*10e-7, third value / z: positive altitude in meters with 0 being at ground level in terrain model.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_BODY_FRD
entry.description: Body fixed frame of reference, Z-down (x: forward, y: right, z: down).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_BODY_FLU
entry.description: Body fixed frame of reference, Z-up (x: forward, y: left, z: up).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_MOCAP_NED
entry.description: Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by a motion capture system, Z-down (x: north, y: east, z: down).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_MOCAP_ENU
entry.description: Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by a motion capture system, Z-up (x: east, y: north, z: up).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_VISION_NED
entry.description: Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by a vision estimation system, Z-down (x: north, y: east, z: down).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_VISION_ENU
entry.description: Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by a vision estimation system, Z-up (x: east, y: north, z: up).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_ESTIM_NED
entry.description: Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by an estimator running onboard the vehicle, Z-down (x: north, y: east, z: down).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_ESTIM_ENU
entry.description: Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by an estimator running onboard the vehicle, Z-up (x: east, y: noth, z: up).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_FRD
entry.description: Forward, Right, Down coordinate frame. This is a local frame with Z-down and arbitrary F/R alignment (i.e. not aligned with NED/earth frame).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_FLU
entry.description: Forward, Left, Up coordinate frame. This is a local frame with Z-up and arbitrary F/L alignment (i.e. not aligned with ENU/earth frame).

entry.name: FENCE_ACTION_NONE
entry.description: Disable fenced mode

entry.name: FENCE_ACTION_GUIDED
entry.description: Switched to guided mode to return point (fence point 0)

entry.name: FENCE_ACTION_REPORT
entry.description: Report fence breach, but don't take action

entry.name: FENCE_ACTION_GUIDED_THR_PASS
entry.description: Switched to guided mode to return point (fence point 0) with manual throttle control

entry.name: FENCE_ACTION_RTL
entry.description: Switch to RTL (return to launch) mode and head for the return point.

entry.name: FENCE_BREACH_NONE
entry.description: No last fence breach

entry.name: FENCE_BREACH_MINALT
entry.description: Breached minimum altitude

entry.name: FENCE_BREACH_MAXALT
entry.description: Breached maximum altitude

entry.name: FENCE_BREACH_BOUNDARY
entry.description: Breached fence boundary

enum.name: FENCE_MITIGATE
enum.description: Actions being taken to mitigate/prevent fence breach

entry.name: FENCE_MITIGATE_UNKNOWN
entry.description: Unknown

entry.name: FENCE_MITIGATE_NONE
entry.description: No actions being taken

entry.name: FENCE_MITIGATE_VEL_LIMIT
entry.description: Velocity limiting active to prevent breach

enum.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE
enum.description: Enumeration of possible mount operation modes

entry.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_RETRACT
entry.description: Load and keep safe position (Roll,Pitch,Yaw) from permant memory and stop stabilization

entry.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_NEUTRAL
entry.description: Load and keep neutral position (Roll,Pitch,Yaw) from permanent memory.

entry.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_MAVLINK_TARGETING
entry.description: Load neutral position and start MAVLink Roll,Pitch,Yaw control with stabilization

entry.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_RC_TARGETING
entry.description: Load neutral position and start RC Roll,Pitch,Yaw control with stabilization

entry.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_GPS_POINT
entry.description: Load neutral position and start to point to Lat,Lon,Alt

enum.name: UAVCAN_NODE_HEALTH

entry.name: UAVCAN_NODE_HEALTH_OK

entry.name: UAVCAN_NODE_HEALTH_WARNING

entry.name: UAVCAN_NODE_HEALTH_ERROR

entry.name: UAVCAN_NODE_HEALTH_CRITICAL

enum.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE

entry.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE_OPERATIONAL

entry.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE_INITIALIZATION
entry.description: The node is initializing; this mode is entered immediately after startup.

entry.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE_MAINTENANCE
entry.description: The node is under maintenance.

entry.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE_SOFTWARE_UPDATE

entry.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE_OFFLINE

enum.name: STORAGE_STATUS
enum.description: Flags to indicate the status of camera storage.

entry.name: STORAGE_STATUS_EMPTY
entry.description: Storage is missing (no microSD card loaded for example.)

entry.name: STORAGE_STATUS_UNFORMATTED
entry.description: Storage present but unformatted.

entry.name: STORAGE_STATUS_READY
entry.description: Storage present and ready.

entry.name: STORAGE_STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED
entry.description: Camera does not supply storage status information. Capacity information in STORAGE_INFORMATION fields will be ignored.

enum.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR
enum.description: Yaw behaviour during orbit flight.

entry.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_HOLD_FRONT_TO_CIRCLE_CENTER
entry.description: Vehicle front points to the center (default).

entry.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_HOLD_INITIAL_HEADING
entry.description: Vehicle front holds heading when message received.

entry.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_UNCONTROLLED
entry.description: Yaw uncontrolled.

entry.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_HOLD_FRONT_TANGENT_TO_CIRCLE
entry.description: Vehicle front follows flight path (tangential to circle).

entry.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_RC_CONTROLLED
entry.description: Yaw controlled by RC input.

enum.name: MAV_CMD
enum.description: Commands to be executed by the MAV. They can be executed on user request, or as part of a mission script. If the action is used in a mission, the parameter mapping to the waypoint/mission message is as follows: Param 1, Param 2, Param 3, Param 4, X: Param 5, Y:Param 6, Z:Param 7. This command list is similar what ARINC 424 is for commercial aircraft: A data format how to interpret waypoint/mission data. See https://mavlink.io/en/guide/xml_schema.html#MAV_CMD for information about the structure of the MAV_CMD entries

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_WAYPOINT
entry.description: Navigate to waypoint.
entry.param: Hold time. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at waypoint for rotary wing)
Acceptance radius (if the sphere with this radius is hit, the waypoint counts as reached)
0 to pass through the WP, if > 0 radius to pass by WP. Positive value for clockwise orbit, negative value for counter-clockwise orbit. Allows trajectory control.
Desired yaw angle at waypoint (rotary wing). NaN for unchanged.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_UNLIM
entry.description: Loiter around this waypoint an unlimited amount of time
entry.param: Radius around waypoint. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise
Desired yaw angle. NaN for unchanged.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TURNS
entry.description: Loiter around this waypoint for X turns
entry.param: Radius around waypoint. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise
Forward moving aircraft this sets exit xtrack location: 0 for center of loiter wp, 1 for exit location. Else, this is desired yaw angle. NaN for unchanged.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TIME
entry.description: Loiter around this waypoint for X seconds
entry.param: Radius around waypoint. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise.
Forward moving aircraft this sets exit xtrack location: 0 for center of loiter wp, 1 for exit location. Else, this is desired yaw angle. NaN for unchanged.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_RETURN_TO_LAUNCH
entry.description: Return to launch location

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND
entry.description: Land at location.
entry.param: Minimum target altitude if landing is aborted (0 = undefined/use system default).
Desired yaw angle. NaN for unchanged.
Landing altitude (ground level in current frame).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF
entry.description: Takeoff from ground / hand
entry.param: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor
Yaw angle (if magnetometer present), ignored without magnetometer. NaN for unchanged.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND_LOCAL
entry.description: Land at local position (local frame only)
entry.param: Maximum accepted offset from desired landing position - computed magnitude from spherical coordinates: d = sqrt(x^2 + y^2 + z^2), which gives the maximum accepted distance between the desired landing position and the position where the vehicle is about to land

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF_LOCAL
entry.description: Takeoff from local position (local frame only)
entry.param: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor
Yaw angle (if magnetometer or another yaw estimation source present), ignored without one of these

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FOLLOW
entry.description: Vehicle following, i.e. this waypoint represents the position of a moving vehicle
entry.param: Following logic to use (e.g. loitering or sinusoidal following) - depends on specific autopilot implementation
Ground speed of vehicle to be followed
Radius around waypoint. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_CONTINUE_AND_CHANGE_ALT
entry.description: Continue on the current course and climb/descend to specified altitude. When the altitude is reached continue to the next command (i.e., don't proceed to the next command until the desired altitude is reached.
entry.param: Climb or Descend (0 = Neutral, command completes when within 5m of this command's altitude, 1 = Climbing, command completes when at or above this command's altitude, 2 = Descending, command completes when at or below this command's altitude.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TO_ALT
entry.description: Begin loiter at the specified Latitude and Longitude. If Lat=Lon=0, then loiter at the current position. Don't consider the navigation command complete (don't leave loiter) until the altitude has been reached. Additionally, if the Heading Required parameter is non-zero the aircraft will not leave the loiter until heading toward the next waypoint.
entry.param: Radius. If positive loiter clockwise, negative counter-clockwise, 0 means no change to standard loiter.
Forward moving aircraft this sets exit xtrack location: 0 for center of loiter wp, 1 for exit location

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FOLLOW
entry.description: Begin following a target
entry.param: System ID (of the FOLLOW_TARGET beacon). Send 0 to disable follow-me and return to the default position hold mode.
Altitude mode: 0: Keep current altitude, 1: keep altitude difference to target, 2: go to a fixed altitude above home.
Time to land in which the MAV should go to the default position hold mode after a message RX timeout.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FOLLOW_REPOSITION
entry.description: Reposition the MAV after a follow target command has been sent
entry.param: Camera q1 (where 0 is on the ray from the camera to the tracking device)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ORBIT
entry.description: Start orbiting on the circumference of a circle defined by the parameters. Setting any value NaN results in using defaults.
entry.param: Radius of the circle. positive: Orbit clockwise. negative: Orbit counter-clockwise.
Tangential Velocity. NaN: Vehicle configuration default.
Reserved (e.g. for dynamic center beacon options)
Center point latitude (if no MAV_FRAME specified) / X coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. NaN: Use current vehicle position or current center if already orbiting.
Center point longitude (if no MAV_FRAME specified) / Y coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. NaN: Use current vehicle position or current center if already orbiting.
Center point altitude (MSL) (if no MAV_FRAME specified) / Z coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. NaN: Use current vehicle position or current center if already orbiting.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_ROI
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
entry.param: Waypoint index/ target ID. (see MAV_ROI enum)
ROI index (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
x the location of the fixed ROI (see MAV_FRAME)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_PATHPLANNING
entry.description: Control autonomous path planning on the MAV.
entry.param: 0: Disable local obstacle avoidance / local path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable local path planning, 2: Enable and reset local path planning
0: Disable full path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable, 2: Enable and reset map/occupancy grid, 3: Enable and reset planned route, but not occupancy grid

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_SPLINE_WAYPOINT
entry.description: Navigate to waypoint using a spline path.
entry.param: Hold time. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at waypoint for rotary wing)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_TAKEOFF
entry.description: Takeoff from ground using VTOL mode, and transition to forward flight with specified heading.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_LAND
entry.description: Land using VTOL mode
entry.param: Approach altitude (with the same reference as the Altitude field). NaN if unspecified.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_GUIDED_ENABLE
entry.description: hand control over to an external controller

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_DELAY
entry.description: Delay the next navigation command a number of seconds or until a specified time

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_PAYLOAD_PLACE
entry.description: Descend and place payload. Vehicle moves to specified location, descends until it detects a hanging payload has reached the ground, and then releases the payload. If ground is not detected before the reaching the maximum descent value (param1), the command will complete without releasing the payload.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the NAV/ACTION commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DELAY
entry.description: Delay mission state machine.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_CHANGE_ALT
entry.description: Ascend/descend at rate. Delay mission state machine until desired altitude reached.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DISTANCE
entry.description: Delay mission state machine until within desired distance of next NAV point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_YAW
entry.description: Reach a certain target angle.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the CONDITION commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE
entry.description: Set system mode.
entry.param: Custom mode - this is system specific, please refer to the individual autopilot specifications for details.
Custom sub mode - this is system specific, please refer to the individual autopilot specifications for details.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP
entry.description: Jump to the desired command in the mission list. Repeat this action only the specified number of times

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_SPEED
entry.description: Change speed and/or throttle set points.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_HOME
entry.description: Changes the home location either to the current location or a specified location.
entry.param: Use current (1=use current location, 0=use specified location)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER
entry.description: Set a system parameter. Caution! Use of this command requires knowledge of the numeric enumeration value of the parameter.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_RELAY
entry.description: Set a relay to a condition.
entry.param: Setting. (1=on, 0=off, others possible depending on system hardware)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_RELAY
entry.description: Cycle a relay on and off for a desired number of cycles with a desired period.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_SERVO
entry.description: Set a servo to a desired PWM value.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_SERVO
entry.description: Cycle a between its nominal setting and a desired PWM for a desired number of cycles with a desired period.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FLIGHTTERMINATION
entry.description: Terminate flight immediately

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_ALTITUDE
entry.description: Change altitude set point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAND_START
entry.description: Mission command to perform a landing. This is used as a marker in a mission to tell the autopilot where a sequence of mission items that represents a landing starts. It may also be sent via a COMMAND_LONG to trigger a landing, in which case the nearest (geographically) landing sequence in the mission will be used. The Latitude/Longitude is optional, and may be set to 0 if not needed. If specified then it will be used to help find the closest landing sequence.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_RALLY_LAND
entry.description: Mission command to perform a landing from a rally point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GO_AROUND
entry.description: Mission command to safely abort an autonomous landing.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPOSITION
entry.description: Reposition the vehicle to a specific WGS84 global position.
entry.param: Ground speed, less than 0 (-1) for default
Yaw heading, NaN for unchanged. For planes indicates loiter direction (0: clockwise, 1: counter clockwise)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_PAUSE_CONTINUE
entry.description: If in a GPS controlled position mode, hold the current position or continue.
entry.param: 0: Pause current mission or reposition command, hold current position. 1: Continue mission. A VTOL capable vehicle should enter hover mode (multicopter and VTOL planes). A plane should loiter with the default loiter radius.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_REVERSE
entry.description: Set moving direction to forward or reverse.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_LOCATION
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) to a location. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_WPNEXT_OFFSET
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) to be toward next waypoint, with optional pitch/roll/yaw offset. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_NONE
entry.description: Cancels any previous ROI command returning the vehicle/sensors to default flight characteristics. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CONTROL_VIDEO
entry.description: Control onboard camera system.
entry.param: Transmission: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw
Transmission mode: 0: video stream, >0: single images every n seconds
Recording: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
entry.param: Waypoint index/ target ID (depends on param 1).
Region of interest index. (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
MAV_ROI_WPNEXT: pitch offset from next waypoint, MAV_ROI_LOCATION: latitude
MAV_ROI_WPNEXT: roll offset from next waypoint, MAV_ROI_LOCATION: longitude
MAV_ROI_WPNEXT: yaw offset from next waypoint, MAV_ROI_LOCATION: altitude

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_DIGICAM_CONFIGURE
entry.description: Configure digital camera. This is a fallback message for systems that have not yet implemented PARAM_EXT_XXX messages and camera definition files (see https://mavlink.io/en/services/camera_def.html ).
entry.param: Modes: P, TV, AV, M, Etc.
Shutter speed: Divisor number for one second.
Main engine cut-off time before camera trigger. (0 means no cut-off)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_DIGICAM_CONTROL
entry.description: Control digital camera. This is a fallback message for systems that have not yet implemented PARAM_EXT_XXX messages and camera definition files (see https://mavlink.io/en/services/camera_def.html ).
entry.param: Zooming step value to offset zoom from the current position
Test shot identifier. If set to 1, image will only be captured, but not counted towards internal frame count.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE
entry.description: Mission command to configure a camera or antenna mount
entry.param: roll input (0 = angle body frame, 1 = angular rate, 2 = angle absolute frame)
pitch input (0 = angle body frame, 1 = angular rate, 2 = angle absolute frame)
yaw input (0 = angle body frame, 1 = angular rate, 2 = angle absolute frame)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL
entry.description: Mission command to control a camera or antenna mount
entry.param: pitch depending on mount mode (degrees or degrees/second depending on pitch input).
roll depending on mount mode (degrees or degrees/second depending on roll input).
yaw depending on mount mode (degrees or degrees/second depending on yaw input).
latitude, set if appropriate mount mode.
longitude, set if appropriate mount mode.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST
entry.description: Mission command to set camera trigger distance for this flight. The camera is triggered each time this distance is exceeded. This command can also be used to set the shutter integration time for the camera.
entry.param: Camera trigger distance. 0 to stop triggering.
Camera shutter integration time. -1 or 0 to ignore
Trigger camera once immediately. (0 = no trigger, 1 = trigger)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FENCE_ENABLE
entry.description: Mission command to enable the geofence

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_PARACHUTE
entry.description: Mission command to trigger a parachute

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOTOR_TEST
entry.description: Mission command to perform motor test.
entry.param: Motor instance number. (from 1 to max number of motors on the vehicle)
Motor count. (number of motors to test to test in sequence, waiting for the timeout above between them; 0=1 motor, 1=1 motor, 2=2 motors...)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_INVERTED_FLIGHT
entry.description: Change to/from inverted flight.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_SET_YAW_SPEED
entry.description: Sets a desired vehicle turn angle and speed change.
entry.param: Yaw angle to adjust steering by.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_INTERVAL
entry.description: Mission command to set camera trigger interval for this flight. If triggering is enabled, the camera is triggered each time this interval expires. This command can also be used to set the shutter integration time for the camera.
entry.param: Camera trigger cycle time. -1 or 0 to ignore.
Camera shutter integration time. Should be less than trigger cycle time. -1 or 0 to ignore.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL_QUAT
entry.description: Mission command to control a camera or antenna mount, using a quaternion as reference.
entry.param: quaternion param q1, w (1 in null-rotation)
quaternion param q2, x (0 in null-rotation)
quaternion param q3, y (0 in null-rotation)
quaternion param q4, z (0 in null-rotation)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GUIDED_MASTER
entry.description: set id of master controller

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GUIDED_LIMITS
entry.description: Set limits for external control
entry.param: Timeout - maximum time that external controller will be allowed to control vehicle. 0 means no timeout.
Altitude (MSL) min - if vehicle moves below this alt, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no lower altitude limit.
Altitude (MSL) max - if vehicle moves above this alt, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no upper altitude limit.

Horizontal move limit - if vehicle moves more than this distance from its location at the moment the command was executed, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no horizontal move limit.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ENGINE_CONTROL
entry.description: Control vehicle engine. This is interpreted by the vehicles engine controller to change the target engine state. It is intended for vehicles with internal combustion engines
entry.param: 0: Warm start, 1:Cold start. Controls use of choke where applicable

Height delay. This is for commanding engine start only after the vehicle has gained the specified height. Used in VTOL vehicles during takeoff to start engine after the aircraft is off the ground. Zero for no delay.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MISSION_CURRENT
entry.description: Set the mission item with sequence number seq as current item. This means that the MAV will continue to this mission item on the shortest path (not following the mission items in-between).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the DO commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_CALIBRATION
entry.description: Trigger calibration. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode. Except for Temperature Calibration, only one sensor should be set in a single message and all others should be zero.
entry.param: 1: radio RC calibration, 2: RC trim calibration
1: accelerometer calibration, 2: board level calibration, 3: accelerometer temperature calibration, 4: simple accelerometer calibration
1: APM: compass/motor interference calibration (PX4: airspeed calibration, deprecated), 2: airspeed calibration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_SET_SENSOR_OFFSETS
entry.description: Set sensor offsets. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: Sensor to adjust the offsets for: 0: gyros, 1: accelerometer, 2: magnetometer, 3: barometer, 4: optical flow, 5: second magnetometer, 6: third magnetometer
X axis offset (or generic dimension 1), in the sensor's raw units
Y axis offset (or generic dimension 2), in the sensor's raw units
Z axis offset (or generic dimension 3), in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 4, in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 5, in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 6, in the sensor's raw units

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_UAVCAN
entry.description: Trigger UAVCAN config. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: 1: Trigger actuator ID assignment and direction mapping.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_STORAGE
entry.description: Request storage of different parameter values and logs. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: Parameter storage: 0: READ FROM FLASH/EEPROM, 1: WRITE CURRENT TO FLASH/EEPROM, 2: Reset to defaults
Mission storage: 0: READ FROM FLASH/EEPROM, 1: WRITE CURRENT TO FLASH/EEPROM, 2: Reset to defaults
Onboard logging: 0: Ignore, 1: Start default rate logging, -1: Stop logging, > 1: logging rate (e.g. set to 1000 for 1000 Hz logging)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_REBOOT_SHUTDOWN
entry.description: Request the reboot or shutdown of system components.
entry.param: 0: Do nothing for autopilot, 1: Reboot autopilot, 2: Shutdown autopilot, 3: Reboot autopilot and keep it in the bootloader until upgraded.
0: Do nothing for onboard computer, 1: Reboot onboard computer, 2: Shutdown onboard computer, 3: Reboot onboard computer and keep it in the bootloader until upgraded.
WIP: 0: Do nothing for camera, 1: Reboot onboard camera, 2: Shutdown onboard camera, 3: Reboot onboard camera and keep it in the bootloader until upgraded
WIP: 0: Do nothing for mount (e.g. gimbal), 1: Reboot mount, 2: Shutdown mount, 3: Reboot mount and keep it in the bootloader until upgraded
WIP: ID (e.g. camera ID -1 for all IDs)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_OVERRIDE_GOTO
entry.description: Override current mission with command to pause mission, pause mission and move to position, continue/resume mission. When param 1 indicates that the mission is paused (MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD), param 2 defines whether it holds in place or moves to another position.
entry.param: MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD: pause mission and either hold or move to specified position (depending on param2), MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE: resume mission.
MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION: hold at current position, MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION: hold at specified position.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_MISSION_START
entry.description: start running a mission
entry.param: first_item: the first mission item to run
last_item: the last mission item to run (after this item is run, the mission ends)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM
entry.description: Arms / Disarms a component
entry.param: 0: arm-disarm unless prevented by safety checks (i.e. when landed), 21196: force arming/disarming (e.g. allow arming to override preflight checks and disarming in flight)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ILLUMINATOR_ON_OFF
entry.description: Turns illuminators ON/OFF. An illuminator is a light source that is used for lighting up dark areas external to the sytstem: e.g. a torch or searchlight (as opposed to a light source for illuminating the system itself, e.g. an indicator light).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_GET_HOME_POSITION
entry.description: Request the home position from the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_START_RX_PAIR
entry.description: Starts receiver pairing.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_GET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL
entry.description: Request the interval between messages for a particular MAVLink message ID. The receiver should ACK the command and then emit its response in a MESSAGE_INTERVAL message.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL
entry.description: Set the interval between messages for a particular MAVLink message ID. This interface replaces REQUEST_DATA_STREAM.
entry.param: The interval between two messages. Set to -1 to disable and 0 to request default rate.
Target address of message stream (if message has target address fields). 0: Flight-stack default (recommended), 1: address of requestor, 2: broadcast.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE
entry.description: Request the target system(s) emit a single instance of a specified message (i.e. a "one-shot" version of MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL).
entry.param: The MAVLink message ID of the requested message.
Index id (if appropriate). The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message.
The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).
The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).
The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).
The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).
Target address for requested message (if message has target address fields). 0: Flight-stack default, 1: address of requestor, 2: broadcast.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_PROTOCOL_VERSION
entry.description: Request MAVLink protocol version compatibility
entry.param: 1: Request supported protocol versions by all nodes on the network

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_AUTOPILOT_CAPABILITIES
entry.description: Request autopilot capabilities. The receiver should ACK the command and then emit its capabilities in an AUTOPILOT_VERSION message

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_INFORMATION
entry.description: Request camera information (CAMERA_INFORMATION).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_SETTINGS
entry.description: Request camera settings (CAMERA_SETTINGS).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_STORAGE_INFORMATION
entry.description: Request storage information (STORAGE_INFORMATION). Use the command's target_component to target a specific component's storage.
entry.param: Storage ID (0 for all, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_STORAGE_FORMAT
entry.description: Format a storage medium. Once format is complete, a STORAGE_INFORMATION message is sent. Use the command's target_component to target a specific component's storage.
entry.param: Storage ID (1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS
entry.description: Request camera capture status (CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS)
entry.param: 0: No Action 1: Request camera capture status

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_FLIGHT_INFORMATION
entry.description: Request flight information (FLIGHT_INFORMATION)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_RESET_CAMERA_SETTINGS
entry.description: Reset all camera settings to Factory Default

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_MODE
entry.description: Set camera running mode. Use NaN for reserved values. GCS will send a MAV_CMD_REQUEST_VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS command after a mode change if the camera supports video streaming.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_ZOOM
entry.description: Set camera zoom. Camera must respond with a CAMERA_SETTINGS message (on success). Use NaN for reserved values.
entry.param: Zoom value. The range of valid values depend on the zoom type.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_FOCUS
entry.description: Set camera focus. Camera must respond with a CAMERA_SETTINGS message (on success). Use NaN for reserved values.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_JUMP_TAG
entry.description: Tagged jump target. Can be jumped to with MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP_TAG.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP_TAG
entry.description: Jump to the matching tag in the mission list. Repeat this action for the specified number of times. A mission should contain a single matching tag for each jump. If this is not the case then a jump to a missing tag should complete the mission, and a jump where there are multiple matching tags should always select the one with the lowest mission sequence number.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_IMAGE_START_CAPTURE
entry.description: Start image capture sequence. Sends CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED after each capture. Use NaN for reserved values.
entry.param: Desired elapsed time between two consecutive pictures (in seconds). Minimum values depend on hardware (typically greater than 2 seconds).
Total number of images to capture. 0 to capture forever/until MAV_CMD_IMAGE_STOP_CAPTURE.

Capture sequence number starting from 1. This is only valid for single-capture (param3 == 1). Increment the capture ID for each capture command to prevent double captures when a command is re-transmitted. Use 0 to ignore it.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_IMAGE_STOP_CAPTURE
entry.description: Stop image capture sequence Use NaN for reserved values.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURE
entry.description: Re-request a CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURE message. Use NaN for reserved values.
entry.param: Sequence number for missing CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURE message

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_TRIGGER_CONTROL
entry.description: Enable or disable on-board camera triggering system.
entry.param: Trigger enable/disable (0 for disable, 1 for start), -1 to ignore
1 to reset the trigger sequence, -1 or 0 to ignore
1 to pause triggering, but without switching the camera off or retracting it. -1 to ignore

entry.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_START_CAPTURE
entry.description: Starts video capture (recording). Use NaN for reserved values.
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams)
Frequency CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS messages should be sent while recording (0 for no messages, otherwise frequency)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_STOP_CAPTURE
entry.description: Stop the current video capture (recording). Use NaN for reserved values.
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_START_STREAMING
entry.description: Start video streaming
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_STOP_STREAMING
entry.description: Stop the given video stream
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_VIDEO_STREAM_INFORMATION
entry.description: Request video stream information (VIDEO_STREAM_INFORMATION)
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS
entry.description: Request video stream status (VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS)
entry.param: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_LOGGING_START
entry.description: Request to start streaming logging data over MAVLink (see also LOGGING_DATA message)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_LOGGING_STOP
entry.description: Request to stop streaming log data over MAVLink

entry.name: MAV_CMD_AIRFRAME_CONFIGURATION
entry.param: Landing gear position (Down: 0, Up: 1, NaN for no change)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONTROL_HIGH_LATENCY
entry.description: Request to start/stop transmitting over the high latency telemetry
entry.param: Control transmission over high latency telemetry (0: stop, 1: start)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PANORAMA_CREATE
entry.description: Create a panorama at the current position
entry.param: Viewing angle horizontal of the panorama (+- 0.5 the total angle)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_VTOL_TRANSITION
entry.description: Request VTOL transition
entry.param: The target VTOL state. Only MAV_VTOL_STATE_MC and MAV_VTOL_STATE_FW can be used.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ARM_AUTHORIZATION_REQUEST
entry.description: Request authorization to arm the vehicle to a external entity, the arm authorizer is responsible to request all data that is needs from the vehicle before authorize or deny the request. If approved the progress of command_ack message should be set with period of time that this authorization is valid in seconds or in case it was denied it should be set with one of the reasons in ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON.
entry.param: Vehicle system id, this way ground station can request arm authorization on behalf of any vehicle

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_GUIDED_SUBMODE_STANDARD
entry.description: This command sets the submode to standard guided when vehicle is in guided mode. The vehicle holds position and altitude and the user can input the desired velocities along all three axes.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_GUIDED_SUBMODE_CIRCLE
entry.description: This command sets submode circle when vehicle is in guided mode. Vehicle flies along a circle facing the center of the circle. The user can input the velocity along the circle and change the radius. If no input is given the vehicle will hold position.
entry.param: Radius of desired circle in CIRCLE_MODE
Unscaled target latitude of center of circle in CIRCLE_MODE
Unscaled target longitude of center of circle in CIRCLE_MODE

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_GATE
entry.description: Delay mission state machine until gate has been reached.
entry.param: Geometry: 0: orthogonal to path between previous and next waypoint.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_RETURN_POINT
entry.description: Fence return point. There can only be one fence return point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_POLYGON_VERTEX_INCLUSION
entry.description: Fence vertex for an inclusion polygon (the polygon must not be self-intersecting). The vehicle must stay within this area. Minimum of 3 vertices required.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_POLYGON_VERTEX_EXCLUSION
entry.description: Fence vertex for an exclusion polygon (the polygon must not be self-intersecting). The vehicle must stay outside this area. Minimum of 3 vertices required.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_CIRCLE_INCLUSION
entry.description: Circular fence area. The vehicle must stay inside this area.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_CIRCLE_EXCLUSION
entry.description: Circular fence area. The vehicle must stay outside this area.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_RALLY_POINT
entry.description: Rally point. You can have multiple rally points defined.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_UAVCAN_GET_NODE_INFO
entry.description: Commands the vehicle to respond with a sequence of messages UAVCAN_NODE_INFO, one message per every UAVCAN node that is online. Note that some of the response messages can be lost, which the receiver can detect easily by checking whether every received UAVCAN_NODE_STATUS has a matching message UAVCAN_NODE_INFO received earlier; if not, this command should be sent again in order to request re-transmission of the node information messages.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PAYLOAD_PREPARE_DEPLOY
entry.description: Deploy payload on a Lat / Lon / Alt position. This includes the navigation to reach the required release position and velocity.
entry.param: Operation mode. 0: prepare single payload deploy (overwriting previous requests), but do not execute it. 1: execute payload deploy immediately (rejecting further deploy commands during execution, but allowing abort). 2: add payload deploy to existing deployment list.
Desired approach vector in compass heading. A negative value indicates the system can define the approach vector at will.
Desired ground speed at release time. This can be overridden by the airframe in case it needs to meet minimum airspeed. A negative value indicates the system can define the ground speed at will.
Minimum altitude clearance to the release position. A negative value indicates the system can define the clearance at will.
Latitude unscaled for MISSION_ITEM or in 1e7 degrees for MISSION_ITEM_INT
Longitude unscaled for MISSION_ITEM or in 1e7 degrees for MISSION_ITEM_INT

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PAYLOAD_CONTROL_DEPLOY
entry.description: Control the payload deployment.
entry.param: Operation mode. 0: Abort deployment, continue normal mission. 1: switch to payload deployment mode. 100: delete first payload deployment request. 101: delete all payload deployment requests.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_1
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_2
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_3
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_4
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_5
entry.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_1
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_2
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_3
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_4
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_5
entry.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_1
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_2
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_3
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_4
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_USER_5
entry.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

enum.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM
enum.description: A data stream is not a fixed set of messages, but rather a recommendation to the autopilot software. Individual autopilots may or may not obey the recommended messages.

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_ALL
entry.description: Enable all data streams

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_RAW_SENSORS
entry.description: Enable IMU_RAW, GPS_RAW, GPS_STATUS packets.

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_EXTENDED_STATUS
entry.description: Enable GPS_STATUS, CONTROL_STATUS, AUX_STATUS

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_RC_CHANNELS
entry.description: Enable RC_CHANNELS_SCALED, RC_CHANNELS_RAW, SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_RAW_CONTROLLER
entry.description: Enable ATTITUDE_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT, POSITION_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT, NAV_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT.

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_POSITION
entry.description: Enable LOCAL_POSITION, GLOBAL_POSITION/GLOBAL_POSITION_INT messages.

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_EXTRA1
entry.description: Dependent on the autopilot

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_EXTRA2
entry.description: Dependent on the autopilot

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_EXTRA3
entry.description: Dependent on the autopilot

enum.name: MAV_ROI
enum.description: The ROI (region of interest) for the vehicle. This can be be used by the vehicle for camera/vehicle attitude alignment (see MAV_CMD_NAV_ROI).

entry.description: No region of interest.

entry.name: MAV_ROI_WPNEXT
entry.description: Point toward next waypoint, with optional pitch/roll/yaw offset.

entry.name: MAV_ROI_WPINDEX
entry.description: Point toward given waypoint.

entry.name: MAV_ROI_LOCATION
entry.description: Point toward fixed location.

entry.name: MAV_ROI_TARGET
entry.description: Point toward of given id.

enum.name: MAV_CMD_ACK
enum.description: ACK / NACK / ERROR values as a result of MAV_CMDs and for mission item transmission.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_OK
entry.description: Command / mission item is ok.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_FAIL
entry.description: Generic error message if none of the other reasons fails or if no detailed error reporting is implemented.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_ACCESS_DENIED
entry.description: The system is refusing to accept this command from this source / communication partner.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_NOT_SUPPORTED
entry.description: Command or mission item is not supported, other commands would be accepted.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_COORDINATE_FRAME_NOT_SUPPORTED
entry.description: The coordinate frame of this command / mission item is not supported.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_COORDINATES_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The coordinate frame of this command is ok, but he coordinate values exceed the safety limits of this system. This is a generic error, please use the more specific error messages below if possible.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_X_LAT_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The X or latitude value is out of range.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_Y_LON_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The Y or longitude value is out of range.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_Z_ALT_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The Z or altitude value is out of range.

enum.name: MAV_RESULT
enum.description: Result from a MAVLink command (MAV_CMD)

entry.name: MAV_RESULT_ACCEPTED
entry.description: Command is valid (is supported and has valid parameters), and was executed.

entry.name: MAV_RESULT_TEMPORARILY_REJECTED
entry.description: Command is valid, but cannot be executed at this time. This is used to indicate a problem that should be fixed just by waiting (e.g. a state machine is busy, can't arm because have not got GPS lock, etc.). Retrying later should work.

entry.name: MAV_RESULT_DENIED
entry.description: Command is invalid (is supported but has invalid parameters). Retrying same command and parameters will not work.

entry.name: MAV_RESULT_UNSUPPORTED
entry.description: Command is not supported (unknown).

entry.name: MAV_RESULT_FAILED
entry.description: Command is valid, but execution has failed. This is used to indicate any non-temporary or unexpected problem, i.e. any problem that must be fixed before the command can succeed/be retried. For example, attempting to write a file when out of memory, attempting to arm when sensors are not calibrated, etc.

entry.name: MAV_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS
entry.description: Command is valid and is being executed. This will be followed by further progress updates, i.e. the component may send further COMMAND_ACK messages with result MAV_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS (at a rate decided by the implementation), and must terminate by sending a COMMAND_ACK message with final result of the operation. The COMMAND_ACK.progress field can be used to indicate the progress of the operation. There is no need for the sender to retry the command, but if done during execution, the component will return MAV_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS with an updated progress.

enum.name: MAV_MISSION_RESULT
enum.description: Result of mission operation (in a MISSION_ACK message).

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_ACCEPTED
entry.description: mission accepted OK

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_ERROR
entry.description: Generic error / not accepting mission commands at all right now.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_UNSUPPORTED_FRAME
entry.description: Coordinate frame is not supported.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_UNSUPPORTED
entry.description: Command is not supported.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_NO_SPACE
entry.description: Mission item exceeds storage space.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID
entry.description: One of the parameters has an invalid value.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM1
entry.description: param1 has an invalid value.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM2
entry.description: param2 has an invalid value.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM3
entry.description: param3 has an invalid value.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM4
entry.description: param4 has an invalid value.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM5_X
entry.description: x / param5 has an invalid value.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM6_Y
entry.description: y / param6 has an invalid value.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM7
entry.description: z / param7 has an invalid value.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_SEQUENCE
entry.description: Mission item received out of sequence

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_DENIED
entry.description: Not accepting any mission commands from this communication partner.

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_OPERATION_CANCELLED
entry.description: Current mission operation cancelled (e.g. mission upload, mission download).

enum.name: MAV_SEVERITY
enum.description: Indicates the severity level, generally used for status messages to indicate their relative urgency. Based on RFC-5424 using expanded definitions at: http://www.kiwisyslog.com/kb/info:-syslog-message-levels/.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_EMERGENCY
entry.description: System is unusable. This is a "panic" condition.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_ALERT
entry.description: Action should be taken immediately. Indicates error in non-critical systems.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_CRITICAL
entry.description: Action must be taken immediately. Indicates failure in a primary system.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_ERROR
entry.description: Indicates an error in secondary/redundant systems.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_WARNING
entry.description: Indicates about a possible future error if this is not resolved within a given timeframe. Example would be a low battery warning.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_NOTICE
entry.description: An unusual event has occurred, though not an error condition. This should be investigated for the root cause.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_INFO
entry.description: Normal operational messages. Useful for logging. No action is required for these messages.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_DEBUG
entry.description: Useful non-operational messages that can assist in debugging. These should not occur during normal operation.

enum.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY
enum.description: Bitmask of (optional) autopilot capabilities (64 bit). If a bit is set, the autopilot supports this capability.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_FLOAT
entry.description: Autopilot supports MISSION float message type.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_FLOAT
entry.description: Autopilot supports the new param float message type.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_INT
entry.description: Autopilot supports MISSION_INT scaled integer message type.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_COMMAND_INT
entry.description: Autopilot supports COMMAND_INT scaled integer message type.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_UNION
entry.description: Autopilot supports the new param union message type.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_FTP
entry.description: Autopilot supports the new FILE_TRANSFER_PROTOCOL message type.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_SET_ATTITUDE_TARGET
entry.description: Autopilot supports commanding attitude offboard.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_SET_POSITION_TARGET_LOCAL_NED
entry.description: Autopilot supports commanding position and velocity targets in local NED frame.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_SET_POSITION_TARGET_GLOBAL_INT
entry.description: Autopilot supports commanding position and velocity targets in global scaled integers.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_TERRAIN
entry.description: Autopilot supports terrain protocol / data handling.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_SET_ACTUATOR_TARGET
entry.description: Autopilot supports direct actuator control.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_FLIGHT_TERMINATION
entry.description: Autopilot supports the flight termination command.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_COMPASS_CALIBRATION
entry.description: Autopilot supports onboard compass calibration.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MAVLINK2
entry.description: Autopilot supports MAVLink version 2.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_FENCE
entry.description: Autopilot supports mission fence protocol.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_RALLY
entry.description: Autopilot supports mission rally point protocol.

entry.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_FLIGHT_INFORMATION
entry.description: Autopilot supports the flight information protocol.

entry.name: ESTIMATOR_POS_HORIZ_ABS

entry.name: ESTIMATOR_POS_VERT_ABS
entry.description: True if the vertical position (absolute) estimate is good

entry.name: ESTIMATOR_POS_VERT_AGL
entry.description: True if the vertical position (above ground) estimate is good

entry.name: ESTIMATOR_CONST_POS_MODE
entry.description: True if the EKF is in a constant position mode and is not using external measurements (eg GPS or optical flow)

entry.name: ESTIMATOR_PRED_POS_HORIZ_REL
entry.description: True if the EKF has sufficient data to enter a mode that will provide a (relative) position estimate

entry.name: ESTIMATOR_PRED_POS_HORIZ_ABS
entry.description: True if the EKF has sufficient data to enter a mode that will provide a (absolute) position estimate

entry.name: ESTIMATOR_GPS_GLITCH
entry.description: True if the EKF has detected a GPS glitch

entry.name: ESTIMATOR_ACCEL_ERROR
entry.description: True if the EKF has detected bad accelerometer data

entry.name: MOTOR_TEST_ORDER_DEFAULT
entry.description: default autopilot motor test method

entry.name: MOTOR_TEST_ORDER_SEQUENCE
entry.description: motor numbers are specified as their index in a predefined vehicle-specific sequence

entry.name: MOTOR_TEST_ORDER_BOARD
entry.description: motor numbers are specified as the output as labeled on the board

entry.name: MOTOR_TEST_THROTTLE_PERCENT
entry.description: throttle as a percentage from 0 ~ 100

entry.name: MOTOR_TEST_THROTTLE_PWM
entry.description: throttle as an absolute PWM value (normally in range of 1000~2000)

entry.name: MOTOR_TEST_THROTTLE_PILOT
entry.description: throttle pass-through from pilot's transmitter

entry.name: MOTOR_TEST_COMPASS_CAL
entry.description: per-motor compass calibration test

entry.description: ignore altitude field

entry.name: GPS_INPUT_IGNORE_FLAG_HDOP
entry.description: ignore hdop field

entry.name: GPS_INPUT_IGNORE_FLAG_VDOP
entry.description: ignore vdop field

entry.name: GPS_INPUT_IGNORE_FLAG_VEL_HORIZ
entry.description: ignore horizontal velocity field (vn and ve)

entry.name: GPS_INPUT_IGNORE_FLAG_VEL_VERT
entry.description: ignore vertical velocity field (vd)

entry.name: GPS_INPUT_IGNORE_FLAG_SPEED_ACCURACY
entry.description: ignore speed accuracy field

entry.name: GPS_INPUT_IGNORE_FLAG_HORIZONTAL_ACCURACY

entry.name: GPS_INPUT_IGNORE_FLAG_VERTICAL_ACCURACY

enum.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION
enum.description: Possible actions an aircraft can take to avoid a collision.

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_NONE
entry.description: Ignore any potential collisions

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_REPORT
entry.description: Report potential collision

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_ASCEND_OR_DESCEND
entry.description: Ascend or Descend to avoid threat

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_MOVE_HORIZONTALLY
entry.description: Move horizontally to avoid threat

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_MOVE_PERPENDICULAR
entry.description: Aircraft to move perpendicular to the collision's velocity vector

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_RTL
entry.description: Aircraft to fly directly back to its launch point

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_HOVER
entry.description: Aircraft to stop in place

enum.name: MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL
enum.description: Aircraft-rated danger from this threat.

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL_NONE
entry.description: Not a threat

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL_LOW
entry.description: Craft is mildly concerned about this threat

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL_HIGH
entry.description: Craft is panicking, and may take actions to avoid threat

enum.name: MAV_COLLISION_SRC
enum.description: Source of information about this collision.

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_SRC_ADSB
entry.description: ID field references ADSB_VEHICLE packets

entry.name: MAV_COLLISION_SRC_MAVLINK_GPS_GLOBAL_INT
entry.description: ID field references MAVLink SRC ID

enum.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE
enum.description: Type of GPS fix

entry.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_NO_GPS
entry.description: No GPS connected

entry.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_NO_FIX
entry.description: No position information, GPS is connected

entry.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_2D_FIX
entry.description: 2D position

entry.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_3D_FIX
entry.description: 3D position

entry.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_DGPS
entry.description: DGPS/SBAS aided 3D position

entry.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_RTK_FLOAT
entry.description: RTK float, 3D position

entry.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_RTK_FIXED
entry.description: RTK Fixed, 3D position

entry.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_STATIC
entry.description: Static fixed, typically used for base stations

entry.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_PPP
entry.description: PPP, 3D position.

enum.name: RTK_BASELINE_COORDINATE_SYSTEM
enum.description: RTK GPS baseline coordinate system, used for RTK corrections

entry.name: RTK_BASELINE_COORDINATE_SYSTEM_ECEF
entry.description: Earth-centered, Earth-fixed

entry.name: RTK_BASELINE_COORDINATE_SYSTEM_NED
entry.description: RTK basestation centered, north, east, down

enum.name: LANDING_TARGET_TYPE
enum.description: Type of landing target

entry.name: LANDING_TARGET_TYPE_LIGHT_BEACON
entry.description: Landing target signaled by light beacon (ex: IR-LOCK)

entry.name: LANDING_TARGET_TYPE_RADIO_BEACON
entry.description: Landing target signaled by radio beacon (ex: ILS, NDB)

entry.name: LANDING_TARGET_TYPE_VISION_FIDUCIAL
entry.description: Landing target represented by a fiducial marker (ex: ARTag)

entry.name: LANDING_TARGET_TYPE_VISION_OTHER
entry.description: Landing target represented by a pre-defined visual shape/feature (ex: X-marker, H-marker, square)

enum.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING
enum.description: Direction of VTOL transition

entry.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING_VEHICLE_DEFAULT
entry.description: Respect the heading configuration of the vehicle.

entry.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING_NEXT_WAYPOINT
entry.description: Use the heading pointing towards the next waypoint.

entry.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING_TAKEOFF
entry.description: Use the heading on takeoff (while sitting on the ground).

entry.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING_SPECIFIED
entry.description: Use the specified heading in parameter 4.

entry.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING_ANY
entry.description: Use the current heading when reaching takeoff altitude (potentially facing the wind when weather-vaning is active).

enum.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS
enum.description: Camera capability flags (Bitmap)

entry.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_CAPTURE_VIDEO
entry.description: Camera is able to record video

entry.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_CAPTURE_IMAGE
entry.description: Camera is able to capture images

entry.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_MODES
entry.description: Camera has separate Video and Image/Photo modes (MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_MODE)

entry.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_CAN_CAPTURE_IMAGE_IN_VIDEO_MODE
entry.description: Camera can capture images while in video mode

entry.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_CAN_CAPTURE_VIDEO_IN_IMAGE_MODE
entry.description: Camera can capture videos while in Photo/Image mode

entry.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_IMAGE_SURVEY_MODE
entry.description: Camera has image survey mode (MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_MODE)

entry.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_BASIC_ZOOM
entry.description: Camera has basic zoom control (MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_ZOOM)

entry.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_BASIC_FOCUS
entry.description: Camera has basic focus control (MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_FOCUS)

entry.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_VIDEO_STREAM
entry.description: Camera has video streaming capabilities (use MAV_CMD_REQUEST_VIDEO_STREAM_INFORMATION for video streaming info)

enum.name: VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS_FLAGS
enum.description: Stream status flags (Bitmap)

entry.name: VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS_FLAGS_RUNNING
entry.description: Stream is active (running)

entry.name: VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS_FLAGS_THERMAL
entry.description: Stream is thermal imaging

enum.name: VIDEO_STREAM_TYPE
enum.description: Video stream types

entry.name: VIDEO_STREAM_TYPE_RTSP
entry.description: Stream is RTSP

entry.name: VIDEO_STREAM_TYPE_RTPUDP
entry.description: Stream is RTP UDP (URI gives the port number)

entry.name: VIDEO_STREAM_TYPE_TCP_MPEG
entry.description: Stream is MPEG on TCP

entry.name: VIDEO_STREAM_TYPE_MPEG_TS_H264
entry.description: Stream is h.264 on MPEG TS (URI gives the port number)

enum.name: CAMERA_ZOOM_TYPE
enum.description: Zoom types for MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_ZOOM

entry.name: ZOOM_TYPE_STEP
entry.description: Zoom one step increment (-1 for wide, 1 for tele)

entry.name: ZOOM_TYPE_CONTINUOUS
entry.description: Continuous zoom up/down until stopped (-1 for wide, 1 for tele, 0 to stop zooming)

entry.name: ZOOM_TYPE_RANGE
entry.description: Zoom value as proportion of full camera range (a value between 0.0 and 100.0)

entry.name: ZOOM_TYPE_FOCAL_LENGTH
entry.description: Zoom value/variable focal length in milimetres. Note that there is no message to get the valid zoom range of the camera, so this can type can only be used for cameras where the zoom range is known (implying that this cannot reliably be used in a GCS for an arbitrary camera)

enum.name: SET_FOCUS_TYPE
enum.description: Focus types for MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_FOCUS

entry.name: FOCUS_TYPE_STEP
entry.description: Focus one step increment (-1 for focusing in, 1 for focusing out towards infinity).

entry.name: FOCUS_TYPE_CONTINUOUS
entry.description: Continuous focus up/down until stopped (-1 for focusing in, 1 for focusing out towards infinity, 0 to stop focusing)

entry.name: FOCUS_TYPE_RANGE
entry.description: Focus value as proportion of full camera focus range (a value between 0.0 and 100.0)

entry.name: FOCUS_TYPE_METERS
entry.description: Focus value in metres. Note that there is no message to get the valid focus range of the camera, so this can type can only be used for cameras where the range is known (implying that this cannot reliably be used in a GCS for an arbitrary camera).

enum.name: PARAM_ACK
enum.description: Result from a PARAM_EXT_SET message.

entry.name: PARAM_ACK_ACCEPTED
entry.description: Parameter value ACCEPTED and SET

entry.name: PARAM_ACK_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED
entry.description: Parameter value UNKNOWN/UNSUPPORTED

entry.name: PARAM_ACK_FAILED
entry.description: Parameter failed to set

entry.name: PARAM_ACK_IN_PROGRESS
entry.description: Parameter value received but not yet validated or set. A subsequent PARAM_EXT_ACK will follow once operation is completed with the actual result. These are for parameters that may take longer to set. Instead of waiting for an ACK and potentially timing out, you will immediately receive this response to let you know it was received.

enum.name: CAMERA_MODE
enum.description: Camera Modes.

entry.name: CAMERA_MODE_IMAGE
entry.description: Camera is in image/photo capture mode.

entry.name: CAMERA_MODE_VIDEO
entry.description: Camera is in video capture mode.

entry.name: CAMERA_MODE_IMAGE_SURVEY
entry.description: Camera is in image survey capture mode. It allows for camera controller to do specific settings for surveys.

entry.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_GENERIC
entry.description: Not a specific reason

entry.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_NONE
entry.description: Authorizer will send the error as string to GCS

entry.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_INVALID_WAYPOINT
entry.description: At least one waypoint have a invalid value

entry.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_TIMEOUT
entry.description: Timeout in the authorizer process(in case it depends on network)

entry.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_AIRSPACE_IN_USE
entry.description: Airspace of the mission in use by another vehicle, second result parameter can have the waypoint id that caused it to be denied.

entry.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_BAD_WEATHER
entry.description: Weather is not good to fly

enum.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK
enum.description: Bitmap to indicate which dimensions should be ignored by the vehicle: a value of 0b0000000000000000 or 0b0000001000000000 indicates that none of the setpoint dimensions should be ignored. If bit 9 is set the floats afx afy afz should be interpreted as force instead of acceleration.

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_X_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore position x

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_Y_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore position y

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_Z_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore position z

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_VX_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore velocity x

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_VY_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore velocity y

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_VZ_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore velocity z

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_AX_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore acceleration x

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_AY_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore acceleration y

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_AZ_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore acceleration z

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_FORCE_SET
entry.description: Use force instead of acceleration

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_YAW_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore yaw

entry.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_YAW_RATE_IGNORE
entry.description: Ignore yaw rate

entry.name: MAV_ODID_LOCATION_SRC_LIVE_GNSS
